page.title: 13Home Life
page.content: In this rural area fresh vegetables and fruit can be obtained fairly cheaply and stored in home freezers. Many inhabitants grow at least some of their own produce. Goats milk, honey, milk, cream and eggs can be purchased locally. As natural gas is not available, electricity or solid fuel are the usual sources of power and heat although bottled gas can be obtained. Because of the closeness of the communities help can usually be obtained with transport of the children for any activities but most families own a car as the bus service is non-existant in the evenings to any entertainment in the nearest towns. The last count of family pets produced an average of one dog per household plus a number of cats, ponies, ferrets and rabbits.
